overview.description: A comprehensive guide to setting up and using JupyterLab for local Python development. Learn how to install JupyterLab, create notebooks, manage extensions, work with kernels, and organize your data science projects. Each lesson includes hands-on exercises and best practices for local development workflows.
overview.target_audience: Beginners who want to learn JupyterLab for local Python development and data science projects.
prerequisites: Ability to install software on your computer

modules.title: Getting Started with JupyterLab
modules.description: Introduction to JupyterLab and its installation.

lessons.title: Installing JupyterLab
lessons.summary: Learn how to install JupyterLab on your local machine.

hands_on_labs.title: Lab: Install JupyterLab
hands_on_labs.goal: Successfully install JupyterLab and launch it.

micro_exercises.title: Exercise 1: Verify Installation
micro_exercises.task: Open a terminal and run 'jupyter lab' to verify the installation.

micro_exercises.title: Exercise 2: Create a Virtual Environment
micro_exercises.task: Create a virtual environment and install JupyterLab within it.

knowledge_check.question: What command is used to launch JupyterLab?
knowledge_check.answer: 'jupyter lab'

knowledge_check.question: Why is it important to use a virtual environment?
knowledge_check.answer: To manage dependencies and avoid conflicts.

real_world_use_cases: Setting up a local development environment
common_mistakes: Forgetting to activate the virtual environment

lessons.title: Navigating the JupyterLab Interface
lessons.summary: Explore the JupyterLab interface and its features.

hands_on_labs.title: Lab: Explore the Interface
hands_on_labs.goal: Familiarize yourself with the JupyterLab interface.

micro_exercises.title: Exercise 1: Open a Notebook
micro_exercises.task: Open a new notebook and rename it.

micro_exercises.title: Exercise 2: Use the Command Palette
micro_exercises.task: Access the command palette and find a command to change the notebook type.

knowledge_check.question: What is the purpose of the command palette?
knowledge_check.answer: To access commands quickly without navigating menus.

knowledge_check.question: How can you save a notebook?
knowledge_check.answer: By clicking the save icon or using the shortcut Ctrl+S.

lessons.title: Creating and Managing Notebooks
lessons.summary: Learn how to create, edit, and manage Jupyter notebooks.

hands_on_labs.title: Lab: Create Your First Notebook
hands_on_labs.goal: Create and edit a Jupyter notebook with both code and markdown cells.

micro_exercises.title: Exercise 1: Add Markdown
micro_exercises.task: Create a markdown cell and write a brief introduction.

micro_exercises.title: Exercise 2: Run a Code Cell
micro_exercises.task: Write a simple Python code in a code cell and run it.

knowledge_check.question: What are the two main types of cells in a Jupyter notebook?
knowledge_check.answer: Code cells and Markdown cells.

knowledge_check.question: How do you run a cell?
knowledge_check.answer: By selecting the cell and clicking the run button or pressing Shift+Enter.

modules.title: Working with JupyterLab Extensions
modules.description: Learn how to enhance JupyterLab functionality with extensions.

lessons.title: Installing JupyterLab Extensions
lessons.summary: Understand how to install and manage JupyterLab extensions.

hands_on_labs.title: Lab: Install an Extension
hands_on_labs.goal: Install a popular extension and verify its functionality.

micro_exercises.title: Exercise 1: Enable an Extension
micro_exercises.task: Enable an installed extension and check its features.

micro_exercises.title: Exercise 2: Disable an Extension
micro_exercises.task: Disable an extension and observe the changes.

knowledge_check.question: What command is used to install a JupyterLab extension?
knowledge_check.answer: 'jupyter labextension install <extension-name>'

knowledge_check.question: How can you check installed extensions?
knowledge_check.answer: By accessing the extension manager in JupyterLab.

lessons.title: Popular JupyterLab Extensions
lessons.summary: Explore some popular extensions that enhance JupyterLab.

hands_on_labs.title: Lab: Explore Popular Extensions
hands_on_labs.goal: Install and test a popular extension.

micro_exercises.title: Exercise 1: Install Table of Contents
micro_exercises.task: Install the Table of Contents extension and use it in a notebook.

micro_exercises.title: Exercise 2: Use Git Extension
micro_exercises.task: Install the Git extension and explore its features.

knowledge_check.question: What does the Table of Contents extension do?
knowledge_check.answer: It provides a navigable table of contents for notebooks.

knowledge_check.question: Why is the Git extension useful?
knowledge_check.answer: It allows version control directly within JupyterLab.

lessons.title: Managing Extensions in JupyterLab
lessons.summary: Learn how to manage and troubleshoot JupyterLab extensions.

hands_on_labs.title: Lab: Manage Your Extensions
hands_on_labs.goal: Update and remove extensions as needed.

micro_exercises.title: Exercise 1: Update an Extension
micro_exercises.task: Update an installed extension using the command line.

micro_exercises.title: Exercise 2: Remove an Extension
micro_exercises.task: Remove an extension that is no longer needed.

knowledge_check.question: What command is used to update an extension?
knowledge_check.answer: 'jupyter labextension update <extension-name>'

knowledge_check.question: How can you troubleshoot an extension issue?
knowledge_check.answer: Check the console for error messages and consult the extension documentation.

modules.title: Working with Python Kernels
modules.description: Learn how to manage and use different Python kernels in JupyterLab.

lessons.title: Understanding Jupyter Kernels
lessons.summary: Learn what kernels are and how they work in JupyterLab.

hands_on_labs.title: Lab: Explore Kernels
hands_on_labs.goal: Identify and explore the available kernels in JupyterLab.

micro_exercises.title: Exercise 1: List Installed Kernels
micro_exercises.task: Run a command to list all installed kernels.

micro_exercises.title: Exercise 2: Check Kernel Specifications
micro_exercises.task: Check the specifications of a specific kernel.

knowledge_check.question: What is the role of a kernel in JupyterLab?
knowledge_check.answer: A kernel executes the code contained in a notebook.

knowledge_check.question: How can you list the installed kernels?
knowledge_check.answer: By using the command 'jupyter kernelspec list'.

real_world_use_cases: Using different programming languages in JupyterLab

lessons.title: Switching Between Kernels
lessons.summary: Learn how to switch between different kernels in JupyterLab.

hands_on_labs.title: Lab: Switch Kernels
hands_on_labs.goal: Practice switching between different kernels in a notebook.

micro_exercises.title: Exercise 1: Switch to a Different Kernel
micro_exercises.task: Change the kernel of a notebook to a different installed kernel.

micro_exercises.title: Exercise 2: Check Kernel Compatibility
micro_exercises.task: Verify if a specific kernel is compatible with your notebook.

knowledge_check.question: How do you switch kernels in a notebook?
knowledge_check.answer: By selecting the kernel from the kernel menu or using the command palette.

knowledge_check.question: What should you check before switching kernels?
knowledge_check.answer: Kernel compatibility with the notebook's code.

real_world_use_cases: Running code in different programming languages

lessons.title: Installing Additional Kernels
lessons.summary: Learn how to install and configure additional kernels for JupyterLab.

hands_on_labs.title: Lab: Install a New Kernel
hands_on_labs.goal: Install and test a new programming language kernel.

micro_exercises.title: Exercise 1: Install R Kernel
micro_exercises.task: Install the R kernel and configure it for JupyterLab.

micro_exercises.title: Exercise 2: Test the New Kernel
micro_exercises.task: Run a simple R script in the newly installed kernel.

knowledge_check.question: What command is used to install a new kernel?
knowledge_check.answer: 'pip install <kernel-package>' or 'conda install <kernel-package>'

knowledge_check.question: How can you test if a new kernel is working?
knowledge_check.answer: By running a sample script in the kernel.

real_world_use_cases: Using R or Julia in JupyterLab

modules.title: Organizing Projects in JupyterLab
modules.description: Learn how to effectively organize your data science projects in JupyterLab.

lessons.title: Creating Project Folders
lessons.summary: Learn how to create and manage project folders in JupyterLab.

hands_on_labs.title: Lab: Organize Your Project
hands_on_labs.goal: Create a structured folder system for a data science project.

micro_exercises.title: Exercise 1: Create a New Folder
micro_exercises.task: Create a new folder for your project in JupyterLab.

micro_exercises.title: Exercise 2: Move a File
micro_exercises.task: Move an existing notebook into the new folder.

knowledge_check.question: How do you create a new folder in JupyterLab?
knowledge_check.answer: By right-clicking in the file browser and selecting 'New Folder'.

knowledge_check.question: What is a best practice for naming folders?
knowledge_check.answer: Use descriptive names that reflect the contents.

lessons.title: Managing Files and Notebooks
lessons.summary: Learn how to manage files and notebooks effectively in JupyterLab.

hands_on_labs.title: Lab: Manage Your Files
hands_on_labs.goal: Practice opening, renaming, and deleting files.

micro_exercises.title: Exercise 1: Rename a Notebook
micro_exercises.task: Rename an existing notebook to reflect its content.

micro_exercises.title: Exercise 2: Delete a File
micro_exercises.task: Delete a file that is no longer needed.

knowledge_check.question: How can you rename a file in JupyterLab?
knowledge_check.answer: By right-clicking the file and selecting 'Rename'.

knowledge_check.question: What should you do before deleting a file?
knowledge_check.answer: Ensure that the file is no longer needed.

lessons.title: Using Version Control with Git
lessons.summary: Learn how to use Git for version control in JupyterLab.

hands_on_labs.title: Lab: Version Control with Git
hands_on_labs.goal: Initialize a Git repository and track changes.

micro_exercises.title: Exercise 1: Initialize a Repository
micro_exercises.task: Create a new Git repository in your project folder.

micro_exercises.title: Exercise 2: Commit Changes
micro_exercises.task: Make a change to a notebook and commit it.

knowledge_check.question: What command initializes a Git repository?
knowledge_check.answer: 'git init'

knowledge_check.question: Why is it important to write good commit messages?
knowledge_check.answer: To provide context for changes made in the repository.

objectives: Push changes to a remote repository
real_world_use_cases: Tracking changes in data science projects

modules.title: Data Analysis and Visualization in JupyterLab
modules.description: Learn how to perform data analysis and create visualizations using JupyterLab.

lessons.title: Data Analysis with Pandas
lessons.summary: Learn how to use Pandas for data analysis in JupyterLab.

hands_on_labs.title: Lab: Analyze a Dataset
hands_on_labs.goal: Load and analyze a dataset using Pandas.

micro_exercises.title: Exercise 1: Load a CSV File
micro_exercises.task: Load a CSV file into a Pandas DataFrame.

micro_exercises.title: Exercise 2: Filter Data
micro_exercises.task: Filter the DataFrame based on a condition.

knowledge_check.question: What function is used to load a CSV file in Pandas?
knowledge_check.answer: 'pd.read_csv()'

knowledge_check.question: How can you check for missing values in a DataFrame?
knowledge_check.answer: By using the 'isnull()' function.

lessons.title: Data Visualization with Matplotlib
lessons.summary: Learn how to create visualizations using Matplotlib in JupyterLab.

hands_on_labs.title: Lab: Create Visualizations
hands_on_labs.goal: Create and customize visualizations using Matplotlib.

micro_exercises.title: Exercise 1: Create a Line Plot
micro_exercises.task: Create a line plot from a dataset.

micro_exercises.title: Exercise 2: Customize a Bar Plot
micro_exercises.task: Add labels and a title to a bar plot.

knowledge_check.question: What function is used to create a line plot in Matplotlib?
knowledge_check.answer: 'plt.plot()'

knowledge_check.question: How can you save a plot to a file?
knowledge_check.answer: 'plt.savefig()'

lessons.title: Presenting Findings in Notebooks
lessons.summary: Learn how to present your analysis and visualizations in Jupyter notebooks.

hands_on_labs.title: Lab: Create a Report
hands_on_labs.goal: Combine analysis and visualizations into a cohesive report.

micro_exercises.title: Exercise 1: Add a Markdown Section
micro_exercises.task: Write a markdown section summarizing your findings.

micro_exercises.title: Exercise 2: Export Your Notebook
micro_exercises.task: Export your notebook to HTML format.

knowledge_check.question: What is the purpose of combining code and markdown?
knowledge_check.answer: To create a narrative that explains the analysis.

knowledge_check.question: How can you share your notebook with others?
knowledge_check.answer: By exporting it or sharing it via GitHub.

modules.title: Capstone Project
modules.description: Apply everything you've learned in a comprehensive project.
module_outcomes: Create a complete data analysis project

lessons.title: Capstone Project Overview
lessons.summary: Introduction to the capstone project and its requirements.

hands_on_labs.title: Lab: Project Planning
hands_on_labs.goal: Outline your project plan and set up your environment.

micro_exercises.title: Exercise 1: Define Your Project Goals
micro_exercises.task: Write down the goals for your capstone project.

micro_exercises.title: Exercise 2: Set Up Your Environment
micro_exercises.task: Create a new folder for your project and set up a virtual environment.

knowledge_check.question: What are the key deliverables for the capstone project?
knowledge_check.answer: A complete data analysis project with a report and visualizations.

knowledge_check.question: Why is project planning important?
knowledge_check.answer: It helps to organize tasks and manage time effectively.

real_world_use_cases: Applying skills in a real-world scenario

lessons.title: Implementing Your Project
lessons.summary: Work on your capstone project and implement your analysis.

hands_on_labs.title: Lab: Implement Your Analysis
hands_on_labs.goal: Conduct data analysis and create visualizations for your project.

micro_exercises.title: Exercise 1: Analyze Your Dataset
micro_exercises.task: Perform data analysis on your chosen dataset.

micro_exercises.title: Exercise 2: Create Visualizations
micro_exercises.task: Generate visualizations to support your findings.

knowledge_check.question: What is the purpose of documenting your findings?
knowledge_check.answer: To provide clarity and context for your analysis.

knowledge_check.question: How can you ensure your visualizations are effective?
knowledge_check.answer: By making them clear and relevant to the analysis.

lessons.title: Presenting Your Project
lessons.summary: Learn how to present your capstone project effectively.

hands_on_labs.title: Lab: Prepare Your Presentation
hands_on_labs.goal: Create a presentation based on your project findings.

micro_exercises.title: Exercise 1: Create a Presentation Outline
micro_exercises.task: Draft an outline for your project presentation.

micro_exercises.title: Exercise 2: Practice Your Presentation
micro_exercises.task: Rehearse your presentation and gather feedback.

knowledge_check.question: What are key elements of an effective presentation?
knowledge_check.answer: Clarity, engagement, and relevance.

knowledge_check.question: How can you gather feedback on your presentation?
knowledge_check.answer: By asking for input from peers or mentors.

capstone.title: Capstone Project
capstone.description: Apply everything you've learned in a comprehensive project.
